title: Set up IP and external access hostname
content:
Role Location
IT / Network administrator GCP Console and DNS provider

Since the suite distributes workloads by load balancer, you need to prepare an external access hostname from your DNS provider's side and reserve a static IP address for the load balancer from the GCP Console. Then, bind the hostname with this static IP to allow users to access SMA services using the bound external access hostname.

Follow the steps below to generate a static IP for the suite from the GCP Console:

  1. Navigate to VPC network > External IP addresses > RESERVE EXTERNAL STATIC ADDRESS.
  2. Give a name to this IP. For example, smax-static-ip.
  3. Under Network Service Tier, select the current project-level tier.
    Note If you choose a different tier from the current project-level tier, the installation will fail.
  4. Under Type, select Regional.
  5. Under Region, select the same region as the prepared VPC.
  6. Click RESERVE to save all the settings.

After the static IP is reserved successfully, you can map it to your external access hostname allocated for the suite from your DNS provider's side.

External references

For static IP's network service tier information, see Network tier overview.
